history.text: Hey! did you enjoy watching th social network?
I liked jesse eisenberg as mark
I found the back story about Facebook very interesting. I'd like to read the book as I've heard it said that they took liberties with the biographical information in the film.
I did not know their was a book. I just have here that it was based on a true story
thats interesting i will have to read that
what was your favorite part

It was based on The Accidental Billionaires by Aaron Sorkin. However, none of the Facebook staff was actually involved with the movie. Hard to tell whether that means its really true and impartial or all fiction.
But then I suppose the lawsuit information would all be public information.
that is true their could have been a lot of exaggeration.
i was surprised it was only a B+cinemascore

Sometimes real life does not fit itself into a nice neat story package for film interpretation! Rotten Tomatoes scored it 9/10 though. I think it might be that the audience is smarter than critics give them credit for.
the critics seem to love david fincher the director and praise how he takes the story to another level
A good director can make a lot of difference in the quality of a film. Aaron Sorkin is an excellent script writer so I'm sure a good script helped, too.
It may be a bit difficult to talk at length about five lines of text, most of which is quotes from critics. LOL.
its interesting how this all started because mark was dumped by his firlfriend
girlfriend
I find it really funny. I'm sure his girlfriend - and the other girls rated on Facemash - found it less amusing.
yea and the fact that their lives are now in a film to be consumed by the public
it also it that the idea of facebook was based on a dating site
It's one thing to sign up to the Harvard dating service, something quite different to have someone upload your photo for rating.
Dating sites are crazy popular though.
It may seem minor - but I am glad they dropped the "The" from Facebook. It makes me think of the detective on Major Crimes- the old guy - who always says "Look on the Twitter thing"
yea im glad the was dropped it does not have the same ring to it
i feel like parker was there to capitalize and saw dollar signs from a mile away

That seems like a - for lack of a better word - a heritage thing. Like only older people want to put "the" in front of website names, book titles and such like. (I'm 58) Seems like we are dropping that custom now.

Well, I'm glad he did. For all it's flaws Facebook is a useful site for making friends and staying in contact with old friends and family. With the tendency now to drift apart all over the country it's nice to be able to check in, find people, see how your friends are doing, et.
etc
that is true, without his push facebook would not have been marketed like it was

even though the twins seemed like entitled boys it was their idea first and I do feel for them to sum 
extent
They all seem a bit like entitled assholes to me. Bunch of Ivy League snobs bringing their soap opera to the courts. But that doesn't mean that investors are not entitled to profit.
Just because they are not very likable.
yes but mark didn't even acknowledge their contribution and didnt give them a chance to invest

mark came off as a awkward boy who saw an 
opportunity and pushed everyone out the way
He really comes off as selfish and self centered from the start.
yes and didn't care for the people he was with from the beginning
okay it was nice talking to you!
